SEARCH

Uses of Interface
org.klojang.jdbc.SessionConfig

Packages that use SessionConfig
Package
Description
org.klojang.jdbc
Database utilities aimed at providing a quick route for database data to be inserted into Klojang templates.

  • Uses of SessionConfig in org.klojang.jdbc

    Methods in org.klojang.jdbc that return SessionConfig
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static SessionConfig
    SessionConfig.getDefaultConfig()
    Returns a SessionConfig instance which does not override any of the defaults provided by the SessionConfig instance.
    default SessionConfig
    SessionConfig.withColumnToPropertyMapper(NameMapper mapper)
    Returns a new instance that is equal to this instance except with the column-to-property mapper set to the specified NameMapper.
    default SessionConfig
    SessionConfig.withEnumsSavedAsStrings()
    Returns a new instance that is equal to this instance except that all enums will be saved by calling toString() on them.
    default SessionConfig
    SessionConfig.withLowerCaseColumnNames()
    Returns a new instance that is equal to this instance except that property names are mapped to column names using the camelCaseToSnakeLowerCase() name mapper.
    default SessionConfig
    SessionConfig.withNamesMappedAsIs()
    Returns a new instance that is equal to this instance except that property names are mapped as-is to column names and vice versa.
    default SessionConfig
    SessionConfig.withPropertyToColumnMapper(NameMapper mapper)
    Returns a new instance that is equal to this instance except with the property-to-column mapper set to the specified NameMapper.
    Methods in org.klojang.jdbc with parameters of type SessionConfig
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static SQL
    SQL.simple(SessionConfig config, Class<?> clazz, String sqlFile)
    Returns a SQL implementation that allows for named parameters, but not for Klojang Templates variables.
    static SQL
    SQL.simple(SessionConfig config, String sql)
    Returns a SQL implementation that allows for named parameters, but not for Klojang Templates variables.
    static SQLInsert
    SQL.simpleInsert(Connection con, SessionConfig config, boolean retrieveKeys, String sql)
    Convenience method for SQL INSERT statements that do not contain Klojang Templates variables.
    static SQLQuery
    SQL.simpleQuery(Connection con, SessionConfig config, String sql)
    Convenience method for SQL SELECT statements that do not contain Klojang Templates variables.
    static SQLUpdate
    SQL.simpleUpdate(Connection con, SessionConfig config, String sql)
    Convenience method for SQL UPDATE statements that do not contain Klojang Templates variables.
    static SQL
    SQL.skeleton(SessionConfig config, Class<?> clazz, String sqlFile)
    Returns a SQL implementation that allows for named parameters and Klojang Templates variables.
    static SQL
    SQL.skeleton(SessionConfig config, String sql)
    Returns a SQL implementation that allows for named parameters and Klojang Templates variables.
    static SQL
    SQL.staticSQL(SessionConfig config, Class<?> clazz, String sqlFile)
    Returns a SQL implementation that supports neither named parameters nor Klojang Templates variables.
    static SQL
    SQL.staticSQL(SessionConfig config, String sql)
    Returns a SQL implementation that supports neither named parameters nor Klojang Templates variables.
    static SQL
    SQL.template(SessionConfig config, Class<?> clazz, String sqlFile)
    Returns a SQL implementation that allows for named parameters and Klojang Templates variables.
    static SQL
    SQL.template(SessionConfig config, String sql)
    Returns a SQL implementation that allows for named parameters and Klojang Templates variables.
    InsertBuilder
    InsertBuilder.withConfig(SessionConfig config)
    Sets the SessionConfig object to be used to fine-tune the INSERT.
